meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to get my groove on and review The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame!

First off, let me just say that I'm a big fan of LEGO games. They're like the perfect blend of fun, humor, and nostalgia - what's not to love?! But, unfortunately, this latest installment has left me feeling... well, underwhelmed.

Now, before I dive into my thoughts on the game, let me just address some of the other critics out there. COGconnected, for instance, called it a "frustrating cash grab." Ouch! That's like saying your favorite childhood toy is now a bunch of useless junk. Yeah, harsh much? Meanwhile, Metro GameCentral just said it was "cheap and nasty" - yikes! Talk about killing the mood!

But hey, I'm here to bring some positivity to the table (or should I say, the LEGO plate?). So, what did I think of the game?

Honestly, I found The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame to be... meh. It's like they took all the fun and excitement out of being a LEGO master builder and replaced it with boredom. Don't get me wrong, the graphics are still super colorful and cute (I mean, who doesn't love a good LEGO aesthetic?), but the gameplay just feels so... stale.

It's like they took a bunch of generic levels, slapped some movie characters on them, and called it a day. I mean, where's the creativity?! Where's the humor? It's all just so... predictable.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But wait, didn't 3DJuegos say this game was actually pretty cool?" And to that, I say... yeah, they did! But even they mentioned some major flaws, like the lack of co-op and some wonky controls. So, yeah, it's not all bad (I mean, it's still LEGO, after all!), but it's definitely not the best.

All in all, The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is a bit of a letdown. It feels more like a cash-in than an actual attempt to make something new and exciting. But hey, if you're a die-hard LEGO fan or have kids who love this sort of thing, it might still be worth checking out.

So, that's my two cents on the game. What do you think? Did I miss the mark or was I spot-on? Let me know in the comments!

And remember, folks: always keep your sense of humor about you, even when playing a subpar LEGO game!
